last_episode_to_air.name: Ride 'Em Cowboy
last_episode_to_air.overview: Tex takes part in the rodeo against Silver City's best rider, Bart Stevens.

name: Four Feather Falls
overview:
Four Feather Falls was the third puppet TV show produced by Gerry Anderson for Granada Television. It was based on an idea by Barry Gray, who also wrote the show's music. The series was the first to use an early version of Anderson's Supermarionation puppetry. Thirty-nine 13-minute episodes were produced, broadcast by Granada from February until November 1960. The setting is the late 19th-century fictional Kansas town of Four Feather Falls, where the hero of the series, Tex Tucker, is sheriff. The four feathers of the title refers to four magical feathers given to Tex by the Indian chief Kalamakooya as a reward for saving his grandson: two allowed Tex's guns to swivel and fire without being touched whenever he was in danger, and two conferred the power of speech on Tex's horse and dog.

Tex's speaking voice was provided by Nicholas Parsons, and his singing voice by Michael Holliday. The series has never been repeated on British television, but it was released on DVD in 2005.

episodes.name: How It Began
episodes.overview: Sheriff Tex Tucker arrives in Four Feather Falls.

episodes.name: Kidnapped
episodes.overview: Sheriff Tucker must solve a kidnapping.

episodes.name: Pedro Has A Plan
episodes.overview: Pedro has a great idea, but will it all go wrong?

episodes.name: Pedro's Pardon
episodes.overview: Pedro is pardoned by Tex.

episodes.name: A Close Shave
episodes.overview: Tex Tucker has a close call.

episodes.name: Indian Attack
episodes.overview: Four Feather Falls is attacked by a group of Indians.

episodes.name: Sheriff For A Day
episodes.overview: Tex takes a day off, but who will be the sheriff?

episodes.name: Dusty Becomes Deputy
episodes.overview: Tex promotes Dusty to the position of deputy sheriff.

episodes.name: Gunrunners
episodes.overview: Tex encounters a group of gunrunners and it's his job to bring them in.

episodes.name: Trouble At Yellow Gulch
episodes.overview: Tex experiences a spot of bother at Yellow Gulch.

episodes.name: Frame Up
episodes.overview: Can Tex discover who really committed the crime?

episodes.name: Gold Diggers
episodes.overview: Tex encounters some gold diggers.

episodes.name: Gold Is Where You Find It
episodes.overview: Tex and the gang go looking for gold.

episodes.name: Trapped
episodes.overview: Tex and the gang become trapped in a dangerous situation, but can they save themselves?

episodes.name: The Best Laid Plans
episodes.overview: Even the best plans can go wrong.

episodes.name: Escort
episodes.overview: Pedro and Fernando pose as sheriffs so they can steal a shipment of gold.

episodes.name: The Toughest Guy In The West
episodes.overview: A reward is offered for the capture of Indian Jack.

episodes.name: Ghost of a Chance
episodes.overview: Marvin Jackson is trying to sell the Eureka Silver Mine, but the main buyer, Harman, pays Pedro and Fernando to pretend to be ghosts to bring the price down.

episodes.name: Gunplay
episodes.overview: Two cattle rustlers challenge Tucker to fight without his magic guns.

episodes.name: A Lawman Rides Alone
episodes.overview: As Tex prepares to take a criminal to court, Big Ben plans a jail break.

episodes.name: Jailbreak
episodes.overview: Pedro helps Tex capture some criminals in return for the reward money.

episodes.name: A Little Bit of Luck
episodes.overview: Tex is away visiting family, but in his absence crime runs out of control.

episodes.name: Land Grabbers
episodes.overview: The Circle Z Ranch is under siege from Morg Fenton and Big Ben, but Tex discovers it is outside his area of juristiction and cannot help defend it.

episodes.name: Once a Lawman
episodes.overview: With the townspeople unhappy with Tex's dealing of a spate of robberies, Tex turns in his badge.

episodes.name: Election Day
episodes.overview: Usually Tex is the only one to run for the post of sheriff on election days, but this time Pedro makes a bid for the position.

episodes.name: Gunfight On Main Street
episodes.overview: Tex's old friend arrives in town looking for two criminals. Tex helps him, but they end up in a dangerous showdown on Main Street.

episodes.name: A Bad Name
episodes.overview: Pedro and Fernando steal all of Four Feather Falls' horses and Tex is unable to pursue them until new horses arrive.

episodes.name: Horse Thieves
episodes.overview: Big Ben needs Tex's help after being falsly accused of stealing cattle.

episodes.name: The Ma Jones Story
episodes.overview: Ma Jones falls a scam and is almost swindled out of her shop.

episodes.name: Bandits Abroad
episodes.overview: Fernando bears a striking resemblance to another master criminal, so Pedro comes up with an idea to get the reward money for capturing him.

episodes.name: A Cure for Everything
episodes.overview: A medicine man arrives in town claiming to have a cure for everything and almost puts Doc Haggerty out of business before he discovers the true source of the medicines.

episodes.name: Teething Troubles
episodes.overview: Rocky gets toothache but won't let Doc Haggerty remove it.

episodes.name: Buffalo Rocky
episodes.overview: When several horses are stolen, the only suspects seems to be a buffalo...

episodes.name: Safe As Houses
episodes.overview: A stranger arrives in town claiming to be able to sell things to people they didn't even know they wanted.

episodes.name: First Train Through
episodes.overview: The railroad finally comes to Four Feather Falls connecting it to Dallas, however someone keeps sabotaging the tracks.

episodes.name: Happy Birthday
episodes.overview: The 'fastest and bestest in the westest' arrives in town, worrying Tex that he will attract other gunmen to the town.

episodes.name: Fancy Shooting
episodes.overview: The townspeople plan a party for Tex's birthday.

episodes.name: Ambush
episodes.overview: The train from Dallas is robbed of $10,000.

episodes.name: Ride 'Em Cowboy
episodes.overview: Tex takes part in the rodeo against Silver City's best rider, Bart Stevens.
